Class Ball

java.lang.Object
  mickel.anim.Sprite
      Ball

public class Ball
extends Sprite

Represents a Ball that dynamically bounces around the interior of a rectangular Stage.

Constructor Summary
Ball()
          Constructs a large, red Ball that is initially located in the upper left corner of the screen.
Ball(int width, int height)
          Constructs a small, green Ball that is initially centered on a specified region of the screen.
Ball(int x, int y, int size, Color c)
          Constructs a Ball that initially has the specified location, size, and color.

Constructor Detail

Ball

public Ball()
Constructs a large, red Ball that is initially located in the upper left corner of the screen. algorithm: Assign mySize a value of 100. Assign myPosX and myPosY a value of one half mySize plus one. Assign myDirX a value of 2. Assign myDirY a value of 1. Assign myColor a Color value of RED.

Ball

public Ball(int width,
            int height)
Constructs a small, green Ball that is initially centered on a specified region of the screen. precondition: width >= 0, height >= 0 algorithm: Assign mySize a value of 25. Assign myPosX a value of half of width Assign myPosY a value of half of height Assign myDirX a value of -2. Assign myDirY a value of 5. Assign myColor a Color value of GREEN.

Parameters:
width - Width of the stage
height - Height of the stage

Ball

public Ball(int x,
            int y,
            int size,
            Color c)
Constructs a Ball that initially has the specified location, size, and color. algorithm: Assign mySize a value of size. Assign myPosX the value of x. Assign myPosY the value of y. Assign myDirX the value of 3. Assign myDirY the value of 3. Assign myColor the value of c.

Parameters:
x - The x-coordinate of this Ball's location
y - The y-coordinate of this Ball's location
size - The diameter of this Ball
c - The Color of this Ball
Method Detail

act

public void act()
Performs one frame of movement for this Ball object. precondition: postcondition: The location of this Ball will be incremented by one frame in its current direction of movement. If the resulting location lies beyond the boundaries of the Stage, this Ball's direction will be adjusted accordingly to reflect a "bounce". algorithm: Increment myPosX by myDirX. Increment myPosY by myDirY. Declare an int variable w and initialize it with the value of the width of this Ball's Stage. Declare an int variable h and initialize it with the value of the height of this Ball's Stage. If the left edge of this Ball is less than 0 and this Ball is moving left, negate the value of myDirX. If the right edge of this Ball is greater than w and this Ball is moving right, negate the value of myDirX. If the top edge of this Ball is less than 0 and this Ball is moving up, negate the value of myDirY. If the bottom edge of this Ball is greater than h and this Ball is moving down, negate the value of myDirY.

Overrides:
act in class Sprite

draw

public void draw(Graphics2D g)
Draws a representation of the current state of this Ball onto the graphics canvas, g. precondition: g is the "canvas" of the Stage postcondition: Draws a representation of the current state of this Ball onto the graphics canvas, g. algorithm: Set the Color of g to be myColor. Paint a filled oval onto g that is located at (myPosX, myPosY) with a width and height of mySize.

Overrides:
draw in class Sprite
Parameters:
g - The "canvas" on which this Ball is to be drawn.

getShape

public Shape getShape()
Gets the boundaries of this Sprite. postcondition: Returns a Shape object that corresponds to the characteristics used in the draw() method. algorithm: Return a new Ellipse2D.Double object that uses myPosX and myPosY for the x and y parameters and mySize for the width and height parameters.

Overrides:
getShape in class Sprite
Returns:
The Shape specifying the boundaries of this Sprite

keyPressed

public void keyPressed(Key k)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user pressing a key on the keyboard. A "key press" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:
keyPressed in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The pressed Key

keyReleased

public void keyReleased(Key k)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a key on the keyboard. A "key release" equates roughly ot the first half of a "key type" event, except that is applies to any key on the keyboard, including modifier keys such as SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:
keyReleased in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The released Key

keyTyped

public void keyTyped(Key k)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user types a key on the keyboard. A "key type" equates to a combination of "key press" and subsequent "key release", except that is applies only to UNICODE characters (i.e., SHIFT, CTRL, ALT, arrow keys, etc. do not trigger this method). Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:
keyTyped in class Sprite
Parameters:
k - The typed Key

mouseClicked

public void mouseClicked(int x,
                         int y)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user clicking a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "click" equates to a "press" and subsequent "release" of a single mouse button. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:
mouseClicked in class Sprite
Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseDragged

public void mouseDragged(int x,
                         int y)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user moving the mouse between the time that a "mouse press" and a "mouse release" occurs. The x and y parameters contain information about the mouse's location after the movement has occurred. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:
mouseDragged in class Sprite
Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the mouse position
y - The y coordinate of the mouse position

mouseReleased

public void mouseReleased(int x,
                          int y)
Description copied from class: Sprite
Handles an event that is triggered by the user releasing a mouse button anywhere within the Stage window. A "release" equates to the second half of a "click" event. Subclasses of Sprite should consider overriding this method.

Overrides:

Parameters:
